author: Special Correspondent
text:
A. Ravi, Joint Director of Industrial Safety and Health, addressing workers at Dalmia Cement at Ariyalur.

Safety awareness should be created among employees round the year, said A. Ravi, Joint Director of Industrial Safety and Health, Tiruchi Division.

Delivering the valedictory address at the ‘Safety Week’ celebrations organised at Dalmia Cement at Ariyalur near here recently, he appreciated the safety culture at this factory and urged its management and employees to make the cement plant a role model for adhering to safety norms across the country.

A contest on ‘safety’ was organised on the campus to motivate employees to the significance of safety with an eye on innovation.

The winners were honoured for their creativity in skit, safety songs, slogans, posters and painting.

Kavitha, Deputy Director of Industrial Safety and Health, underlined the role of employees, supervisors and team leaders in ensuring safety at work spot. Safety week programmes sensitise not only workers but also their family members.

Vinayagamoorthi, Assistant Executive Director, Dalmia Cement, said adequate training had been imparted to all in-service employees about safety at various plants. P. Sivakumar, Head, Human Resource, was among those who participated.
title: Safety awareness “essential”
